heading: doc arrested for drug site
subheading: a maryland doctor could go to prison over charges that he illegally prescribed diet pills over the internet.
author: wired news report
text: a maryland doctor who gained notoriety for distributing diet pills over the internet was indicted for 34 counts of illegally prescribing drugs. pietr hitzig, who once ran a successful practice specializing in weight-loss treatments, was arrested thursday after baltimore's us district court unsealed its lengthy indictment, according to a report in the baltimore sun.the criminal charges are the latest problems for hitzig, who surrendered his maryland license to practice medicine in february, over charges of improper sexual relationships with patients, the newspaper reported.hitzig allegedly sold diet pills over the internet between 1996 and 1998, including phentermine and fenfluramine, the latter of which was pulled off the market in 1997 amid concerns that it scarred heart valves. doctors in maryland are required to examine patients before prescribing medication.each of the 34 counts in the indictment carries a maximum penalty of three years in prison. the web site containing hitzig's research is still online, but no longer offers medical services.
